result.execSummary: Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremy L Haas

defendant.name: Haas, Jeremy L
defendant.address: 220 Willow St E, Stevens Point, WI 54481-6139

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Competency Report by  Maureen Leahy, M.D. dated 07-14-2016

8:44 a.m. Defendant Jeremy L Haas in court with attorney Jared Redfield. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases (14CF44, 14CF162 are closed cases discharged after bing found incompetent). Cases: 14CT92,  15CM137, 15CM245, and 15CM392 are being heard as to competency. Parties have recieved competency report. Court summarizes the report and the Parties state their understanding of the report. Atty Redfield make statements. Atty Cousins makes statements. BTC: Cases are discharged but may be reviewed in the future. No further court hearings to be scheduled at this time.
Competency hearing on September 23, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jeremy L Haas in court with attorney Jared Redfield. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are 15CM-137, 14CF-44, 14CF-162, 15CM-245, 15CM-392 and 14CT-92

9:33 AM Court calls cases.
Court states appearances. 

Court addresses the parties. This is a continuation of a hearing.
State has expressed concerns. Court agrees with concerns of the continuing competency issue with Defendant, as though he is prosecution proof and that is armed with non competency status and therefore allowed to go about the community committing crimes without any type of consequence.

This Court asked a while ago, regarding low function in terms of IQ, special needs, that that is the underlying basis of finding him not competent and not likely to become competent to be in the program.  Court reviews what the program results were. 

Court expressed concerns in the last hearing regarding the results and the civil incompetency side of the ledger.   
This Court wanted another competency evaluation.  

Atty Redfield addresses the Court, wishes to call two witneses to establish the chain of what has happened in the chain of order.

9:39 AM L. Nazami is called and sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Redfield.
Exhibit #1 is marked on behalf of Defense.

9:46 AM M. Madlena is called and sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Redfield.
9:51 AM Cross-examination by Atty Cousins.
9:54 AM Court addresses witness as to explanations of this process and charges of Defendant, to bring witness up to date and aware. Court explains what the Court wants further information on.
Examination by the Court.

Court requests that there be more evaluation or another evaluation from a different doctor. It may be the same conclusion but is not sure.  There needs to be some type of structure.

M. Madlena requests a court order.

Atty Cousins will prepare an order for the Court's signature.
Atty Cousins questions the Court for clarifications.
Court replies.

Court is looking for solutions to a problem.

Atty Redfield agrees with the Court's evaluation.  Competency hearing scheduled for September 23, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Competency Examination completed by Rebecca Seifert on 12/31/15 - original filed in 14CF44
Competency hearing on June 21, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Jeremy L Haas in court with attorney Jared Redfield. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 14CF-44, 15CM-245, 14CF-162, 15CM-392 and 14CT-92. 15CM-137 has been referred to as well. 

8:42 AM Court calls cases.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

Older cases are set for a review or to re-evaluate competency. The newer ones are before the Court the first time to determine competency.  In the past Defendant has been found incompetent.

Court is to ask Defendant if Defendant claims to be competent or incompetent.

Defendant claims to be incompetent.

State has evidence to prove otherwise.

8:44 AM Clerk dials Dr. Rebecca Seifert (licensed psychologist).
Court addresses Dr. Seifert, is prepared to testify.

8:45 AM Rebecca Seifert is called and sworn in by the Court.
Direct examination by Atty Cousins.
9:33 AM Cross-examination by Atty Redfield.
9:49 AM Re-direct by Atty Cousins.
9:52 AM Examination by the Court.

Atty Cousins has no further witnesses.
Atty Redfield has no witnesses to call.

Atty Cousins addresses the Court, requests the Court to find Defendant competent for reasons stated on the record.
Atty Redfield addresses the Court, requests the Court to find Defendant not competent for reasons stated on the record.

Court addresses the parties, has heard testimony, has doctor's report to review. 

BY THE COURT:
Court finds Defendant not competent and not likely to become competent. Court wants another competency evaluation, completed by another evaluating physician who routinely does that. Court wants current report to become a part of the new evaluation. Civil competency evaluation. Court will allow 2 months for the evaluation to take place.

Defendant's mother addresses the Court. Defendant does not have a GED. 

10:13 AM Court is in recess.
Competency hearing at 04-19-2016 08:30 am

Defendant Jeremy L Haas in court with attorney Jared Redfield. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 14CF-44, 14CF-162, 15CM-392, 14CF-162, 15CM-245 and 14CT-92.

4:28 PM Court calls cases.
Court states appearances.

The two new files are 15CM-392 and 15CM-245.
Atty Redfield has questioned competency on this Defendant.

Court did order a competency evaluation on all the files.
A report was prepared.
Copies were forwarded to counsel.
Atty Cousins received the report.
Atty Redfield also received the report. 

This is the time for the hearing.

The Court addresses the Defendant whether he claims to be competent or incompetent.

Defendant states he claims to be incompetent.

Atty Cousins addresses the Court, has subpoenad the doctors, feels it is State's obligation to question the doctors. State would like to adjourn the hearing and have the doctors appear in person to question them.  State requests 2 hours.

Atty Redfield addresses the Court, opposes to the State's request for reasons stated on the record.

Court has some concerns as well, based on the reports whether or not Defendant has immunity, whether or not to commit crimes and not to be held responsible.

Court addresses parties.  

Court will allow Atty Cousins to cross examine the doctors and the Court also has questions. 
Court shares Atty Redfield's concerns as well. 

Court will allow for an hour testimony, not two hours.  Competency hearing scheduled for April 19, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Competency hearing at 01-26-2016 03:45 pm

Attorney Jared Redfield in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard for review are 14CF-44 and 14CF-162.  14TR-1078, 1079, 15CM-245, 14CT-92 and 15CM-392 are set for PTC at this time.

10:32 AM Court calls cases.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

14CF-44 and 14CF-162 are to be heard primarily at this time.

Court addresses the Court regarding today's review.

Atty Cousins received a copy of the doctor's report.
Court believes there is nothing in the report that Defendant is in need of a guardian.
Atty Redfield concurs.

Court questions the status on the cases.

Atty Cousins addresses the Court, competency would have to be addressed on the new files. State addresses the files where Defendant was found not competent.

Court addresses the parties, there are two aspects that the Court states for the record.

Atty Cousins addresses the Court, believes there are grounds to question the competency, requests the Court to order competency evaluation on the three new files. 

Atty Redfield addresses the Court, going to raise the competency issue and enter pleas of not guilty. 

Atty Cousins addresses the Court regarding doctor referred to.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds, as to 14CF-162 and 14CF-44 that there is new information, new information being a finding of civil side of ledger of competency, so Court will order a new evaluation of competency.
Court will order initial competency on the other new files.
All file orders will go on the order and the Court will prepare the order.
Defendant will have to cooperate.
Review at 12-07-2015 10:00 am

Defendant Jeremy L Haas not in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 14CF-44 and 14CF-162.

11:37 AM Court calls cases.
Court states appearances.

Notices went out as a review hearing. Notice on the door shows a plea hearing.

Court reviewed the record August 25th, addresses the last hearing.

Defendant was discharged from commitment but Court did indicate the cases were still pending.

Court referred the matter to Corporation Counsel for review.

Matter was going to be continued to this date for reasons stated on the record.

Atty Cousins addresses the Court, the Defendant has other cases, more recent that are in the pretrial conference stage, OAR.  

Atty Cousins addresses the Court, competency was not raised at the initial appearance on the other cases.

BY THE COURT:
Cases to be put on as review on December 7th, 10 AM.  Review scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Review at 11-20-2015 11:30 am

Defendant Jeremy L Haas in court with attorney Jared Redfield. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 14CF44, 14CF162
11:47 a.m.  Court calls the case. 

Court reviews the files.  
L. Kostuchowski-Nazami is present and questioned by the Court. 
Court questions Atty Redfield. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 
Court will set this for another Court review.  Court would like a copy of the competency examination that has been referred to.  He would like to see what the doctors have found with regard to competency in the civil sense. 

Atty Cousins makes statements to the Court re: competency.  Spoke with Dr. Nelson yesterday and the evaluation is nearing completion.  Will speak to Atty Redfield re: testing results. 
Court is not aware of anything with Dr. Nelson.  Questions Atty Cousins.  
Atty Cousins indicates that is for another file on this defendant.  
Atty Redfield makes statements to the Court. 
  Review scheduled for November 20, 2015 at 11:30 am.
dated 01-01-15 (original filed in 14CF44)
Review on August 25, 2015 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Jeremy L Haas in court with attorney Jared Redfield. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are 14CF-44 and 14CF-162.

8:39 AM Court calls cases.
Court states appearances.

Matters are set for a competency hearing today.
Parties are prepared to proceed.

Atty Cousins will be calling one witness, addresses the Court with regards to the witness appearing by telephone.

8:41 AM Clerk calls Doctor Michael Galli, is appearing by telephone.

8:42 AM Dr. Galli is called and sworn in by the Court.
Direct examination by Atty Cousins.
8:59 AM Cross-examination by Atty Redfield.
9:05 AM Dr Galli requests the Court to allow him to make one short phone call. 
BY THE COURT:
Court will allow witness to make one short phone call.

Dr. Galli's other phone does not have enough power, will just continue with questioning.
9:06 AM Cross-examination by Atty Redfield continues.
9:07 AM Examination by the Court.

State has no further testimony.
Atty Redfield has no testimony to present.

Atty Redfield addresses the Court.
Atty Cousins addresses the Court.

Court takes a moment to review files, as well as 11CF-366.
Court reviews Dr. Hurlbut's report.
Court addresses the parties.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds Defendant incompetent and unlikely to become competent within the remaining commitment time.
971.14(6) Court will discharge Defendant from commitment and release Defendant from commitment.
Court may order Defendant to appear at specified intervals.
Court will refer the matter for a guardianship. Defendant and his mother are to make contact with corporation counsel of Portage County for guardianship. Atty Redfield will answer questions as to what a civil guardianship is about.  Defendant may or may not qualify for a civil guardianship but Court will refer this matter to corporation counsel's office to start guardianship meeting. If they do not commence one, then Atty Redfield is to commence one.
Court will not order a competency evaluation for the August 25th's review hearing.
Court reminds Defendant that he remains under a signature bond in this case. Court cannot proceed on the criminal charges but has the authority to review this at specified intervals. Case is not dismissed at this time. Signature bond's conditions are read out loud. 

9:43 AM Court is in recess.  Review scheduled for August 25, 2015 at 11:30 am.
dated 09-30-14 Dr. Galli, Ph.D - original filed in 14CF44
Competency hearing on January 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
from Outpatient Cometency Restoration Program dated 08-15-14 and 05-12-14 - originals filed in 14CF44
from Atty Redfield w/attachments.

Defendant Jeremy L Haas in court with attorney Jared Redfield. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.on behalf of Cass Cousins.   Dr. Nancy Elliott appears by telephone.
8:17 a.m. case is called  (14CF44 and 14CF162) and appearances stated on the record.
The court received a letter from Dr. Elliott re: outpatient compentency restoration program.  The defendant has not been cooperating and may need to be sent to a hospital.
Attorney Redfield states the mother of the defendant is also present in the courtroom.  
Attorney Redfield makes statement to the court.  Defendant makes a statement to the court re: failure to keep some of the appointments with the program
Court questions the defendant.  
Dr. Elliott makes a statement to the court.   
Court gives stern warning to defendant and defense counsel re: OCRP.  
ADA makes statement to the court.
The court states to defense counsel that the defendant is under a one year commitment.
Court informs the defendant will be sent to inpatient if he does not comply with this order.  If there is lack of cooperation or missed appointments, he will placed inpatient hospital.  
Court orders the defendant to continue to participate in the OCRP. 

Attorney Redfield makes additional statement to the court.  
8:36 a.m. Court is in recess.
Behavioral Consultants - Michael Galli, Ph.D.
Status conference on June 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.
**14CF192 and 14CT92 **   Do not operate a vehicle without a valid driver's license.

Attorney Jared C Redfield in court. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case is called and appearances are stated on the record.
Defense attorney states he called the defendant.  Def stated he had a heart attack this weekend.
Def attorney requests additional time to ascertain his whereabouts.
Court will recall after the calendar.

9:20 a.m. Court recalls the matters.    14CF162, 14CT92, 14TR1078, 14TR1079
Address is verified.
Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.

NG to all matters and requests a competency
Court accepts the plea to all charges.
DEfense attorney makes a statement that defendant is in a competency restoration and would like to have these matters as well.
ADA makes statements.  REquests a preliminary hearing on 14CF162 and states there could be a report at this time.

Court sets the matter for a Status conference 
Competency will attach to all cases. 
  Status conference scheduled for June 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.
of Commitment for Treatment CR-206 /s/TTF 04-23-14
Atty Redfield
Initial appearance on April 28, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Jeremy L Haas in court with attorney Jared C Redfield. Veronica F Isherwood appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 14CF-162, 14CT-92, 14TR-1078 and 14TR-1079.

9:04 AM Court calls case.
Atty Isherwood states appearances.

Atty Redfield has received a copy of the complaints, waives reading and enters NOT GUILTY pleas.
A prelim will need to be set for the CF case.

Atty Redfield addresses the Court regarding competency hearing held last week on this Defendant. Defendant is not competent but may be restored.
An evaluation is going to be done, requests that these be heard along with the other cases. (14CF-44)

Atty Isherwood requests that these be adjourned and for Atty Redfield to talk to Atty Cousins and have something scheduled by the end of the day.
Discussion continues.

Matters are adjourned.

 
  Initial appearance scheduled for April 28, 2014 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended
